alert.note: Alert for Deaf Smith; Randall (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued May 27 at 12:29AM CDT until May 27 at 1:30AM CDT by NWS Amarillo
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 130 AM CDT FOR SOUTHWESTERN RANDALL AND SOUTHERN DEAF SMITH COUNTIES... At 1228 AM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Bootleg, or 17 miles north of Friona, moving east at 10 mph. Another severe thunderstorm was located near Hereford, moving northeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Two inch hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to roofs, siding, and trees is possible. People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Locations impacted include... Hereford, Canyon, Mescalero Park, Buffalo Lake, Dawn, Umbarger and Bootleg. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...2.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
